content: No you do not want to import anything. You want to set up a new account with comcast in Thunderbird so it can fetch your mail. Normally this is the default action on a new install. Have you completed the installation?

content:
Setting up your gmail account is as simple as using the menu to add a new account and then selecting an email account from the next menu.

I have no idea what additional security you are talking about, not even some sort of general concept. So you need to be much more specific in what you ask. Perhaps mentioning the name of the product you paid for would allow someone to google it.

content:
There is not yet a version of Thunderbird for Android. So no there is no Thunderbird calendar for android.

K9 is still K9, not Thunderbird.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: If your calendar on the phone is a Google calendar, it can be added to TB as a synced CalDAV calendar: add a new calendar, On the Network, enter the gmail address.... enter the gmail account password in the OAuth window... select the Google calendar.
creator: sfhowes

content: If these are outlook.com or similar MS accounts, these settings tend to work for IMAP: - input: outlook.office365.com. port 993, SSL/TLS, Oauth2 - Output: smtp.office365.com, port 587, STARTTLS, Oauth2
